programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: It's an emotional journey today as Alistair Appleton helps a buyer with a £260,00 budget to escape her small flat near Heathrow airport. She is desperate for some peace and quiet, and is hoping that the Wiltshire countryside will deliver the cottage she's been dreaming of. Talk turns from property to agriculture when Alistair meets a group of young farmers to discuss their views on the future of the industry.

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Five dealers bid to buy an Evel Knievel doll, a 1960s Triang desk and a six-foot tuna.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Idées et conseils d'experts pour entretenir son jardin.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A suivre, les dernières actualités présentées par les équipes rédactionnelles de la BBC, le très réputé radiodiffuseur du service public britannique. Créée en 1922 à Londres, la British Broadcast Corporation est connue pour être la plus ancienne société diffusant des programmes de radio ou de télévision au monde.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A suivre, les dernières actualités présentées par les équipes rédactionnelles de la BBC, le très réputé radiodiffuseur du service public britannique. Créée en 1922 à Londres, la British Broadcast Corporation est connue pour être la plus ancienne société diffusant des programmes de radio ou de télévision au monde.

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Pubs That Built Britain
programme.desc: The duo discover an astonishing scheme in a Carlisle pub.

programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts a general knowledge quiz featuring the greatest quiz team in Britain.

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: Natural World, cette série documentaire, d'origine britannique, compte presque 500 épisodes sur la nature, les animaux, la faune et l'environnement. Découvrez le pouvoir de la nature et de notre planète.

programme.title: My Unique B&B
programme.desc: Saison 2 Episode 15 Simon and team are in Dorset to build a unique and very colorful B&B. Année de réalisation : 2022

programme.title: Flog It !
programme.desc: A special edition of Flog it! from all over the UK, travelling up and down the country revisiting some of the historic venues from the series and bringing brand new valuations and unexpected auctions. Paul Martin goes behind the scenes of Bamburgh to see just what it takes to keep a castle alive.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: The celebrities face their final quizzes, and the week's winner is crowned.

programme.title: B&B By the Sea
programme.desc: It's the turn of rugby star and presenter Ugo Monye to check into the B&B by the sea. Nestled on the wild coast of Northern Ireland, this 19th-century Victorian villa is a very special place. Ugo played for both the England and Harlequins teams, but now he has retired from rugby, that hasn't stopped his adventurous spirit. He comes to the B&B eager to get stuck in to all the challenges the team throws at him. His first stop is seeing if he can bring in the catch of the day. The cold northern Atlantic waters are to thank for providing Northern Ireland with spectacular seafood, and on this trip they're fishing for scallops. With the fresh catch, chef Alex is hoping to put Ugo to work in the kitchen preparing braised fennel, nduja and scallop stew, and for dessert, a chocolate brownie with a creamy Guinness ice cream.

programme.title: Iolo's Borderlands
programme.desc: Iolo Williams explores the borderlands of the old county of Radnorshire. He begins his journey along the banks of the Wye between Hay-on-Wye and Glasbury, where he discovers nesting little-ringed plovers and oystercatchers. Further upriver at Llyswen, he finds spawning sea lampreys - extraordinary metre-long jawless fish. In woodlands below the Black Mountains, he comes up close with a dormouse among the ancient oak trees which began life during the reign of Elizabeth I. On Stanner Rocks near Kington, he walks on some of the oldest rocks in Wales and discovers rare plants including one that grows nowhere else in Britain. Iolo also looks for roe deer in the Radnor Forest and yellowhammers on Offa's Dyke.

programme.title: Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: Calum checks on the progress of the variety of supermarket bulbs he bought last year.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Idées et conseils d'experts pour entretenir son jardin.

programme.title: Pilgrimage: The Road to Santiago
programme.desc: With less than a week to go before they join tens of thousands of people in Fatima for the annual celebration of the Miracle of the Sun, the pilgrims decide to speed up their journey. They climb the 570 steps to the Sanctuary of Bom Jesus do Monte, try the centuries-old tradition of suckling pig in Mealhada, and visit the tomb of one of the country's most famous women, the queen and saint Isabel.

programme.title: Cunk on Britain
programme.desc: In this insightful mockumentary series from Charlie Brooker, Philomena Cunk takes us on a journey right up Britain's history, to discover who we really are, how we got here and why. Along the way Philomena travels the length and breadth of the country enlisting the help of a variety of experts. In this third episode, Philomena's examining the Victorians and is joined by Chris Packham who tries to shed some light on Darwin's discoveries. Starring Diane Morgan.

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: The day's important national and international news stories. With Victoria Derbyshire.

programme.title: MOTDx
programme.desc: Jermaine Jenas and the team bring you more Premier League lifestyle and culture.

programme.title: Secrets of the Chippendales Murders
programme.desc: Saison 1 Episode 3 The NYPD investigate multiple leads into the murder of Nick De Noia. Possible motives include a love triangle, insurance fraud, and an angry boss--all of which lead nowhere. Years later, the FBI receive a tip from a hitman named 'Strawberry', who blows the case wide open. Année de réalisation : 2021

programme.title: Christine McGuinness: Unmasking My Autism
programme.desc: In 2021, 33-year-old mother of three Christine McGuinness discovered that she was autistic, and suddenly, for the very first time, her whole life began to make sense. All the struggles she had faced growing up became clear, and Christine started to look at things from a new perspective and begin to make sense of who she really is. There are thousands of women in the UK, just like Christine, who have been battling with undiagnosed autism for decades, and now Christine is looking for answers. Why did it take so long before she received a diagnosis? What impact has this had on her life? How many other women out there have been let down too? And what can be done to improve the lives of autistic women and girls?

programme.title: The Holy Land and Us - Our Untold Stories
programme.desc: Rob and Sarah meet descendants of those caught up in the creation of the state of Israel.

programme.title: Mission déco
programme.desc: The designers make over three classrooms of a children's nursery in Oxfordshire.
